COMMENT_TX: Debut game for umpire Bill McGowan
To the bullpen; Lamar played it poorly
Cleared RF wall and bounced up on a porch rooftop
High throw caused Harris to leap/collide with Hale
Mean hop past a charging Hale
Perfect peg but Simmons slid away from Rogell's tag
Hit concrete wall just beyond Miller's reach and rebounded away from him.
With the count 3-1 to Flagstead to start the 6th, time was called by Ump Dinneen due to rain.  After 30-minute wait the game was called.
Raced to the A's bench and made catch standing on their bats
Texas Leaguer; Goslin showed rare speed
Ruel caught short hop and made a stretch tag
Close play at 1B on DP attempt
Off wire screen atop concrete wall
Masterful 1-handed stop but the low throw to 2B hit Bishop and rolled into LCF.

When Witt fumbled, Lamar tried to score but turned his ankle rounding 3B and stopped dead.  Simmons reached 3B about the same time Lamar returned to that bag.  Miller dashed for 2B, cutting off Simmons's line of retreat.  By the time the ball was thrown to Ward, Lamar was hobbling to the plate, hardly more than walking.  Ward started running toward the plate but stopped at the pitcher's mound; all he needed was a leisurely toss, but his throw home sailed over O'Neill.
Lamar hurt himself rounding 1B last inning
Bishop hit on leg by high bounder
Miller pretended to fumble it and trapped Witt off 2B. O'Neill then broke for home, changed his mind, and was out returning to 3B.
Into upper deck of LF stands; only the second clout ever hit upstairs at Shibe (Simmons hit the first, too).
Gehrig made a game run but it fell in front of him
Gehrig complained bitterly over the called 3rd strike

Nearly HR; just beyond the leaping Harris' reach

Miller ducked but it hit his bat
Ump McGowan ruled foul but was overruled by Dinneen; WS1 argued to no avail.
Bishop grabbed high throw and applied the tag
Bad hop got away from Wanninger
NYT: Meusel loafed and let Combs do all the work as it went to CF wall.  PDL: It looked like it was Meusel's ball but he never budged.  Gallant effort by Combs but it was too far.
High bound over Poole when it hit the bag
Rommel took the throw to 1B but missed the bag
Lamar was run down quickly by Schang, trapping Miller between 1B & 2B, but Simmons took a few stops off 3B and was doubled.
Through the drawn-in infield, just past Dugan
Pretty running catch with his back to the plate
Perkins declared safe after a consultation by the umpires; the Yankees argued long and hard to no avail. During this AB Dykes missed HR in LF seats (foul by a foot).
Poole stepped on 1B and threw to Galloway who chased Combs back toward 1B.
Near HR off top of fence; bounced back so rapidly Poole didn't want to chance Meusel's arm.

Over Cobb to the furthest corner of CF.  Hale arrived a step ahead of Tavener's relay.

umpchange,2,umphome,dinnb101 umpchange,2,ump1b,rowlp801 umpchange,2,ump2b,(None) As Spurgeon crossed the plate he ran full force into Ump Owens and knocked him flat. Owens was carried from the field and taken to the hospital where it was diagnosed as a back sprain.  He should be able to report to duty in a day or so. Ump Dinneen took his place behind the plate.
Liner over 2B; Simmons came in for it but it hopped high over him and rolled to the flagpole.
Miller cut his hand when he fell going after Lee's triple
Threw into CF when no one covered 2B
Hit next to the scoreboard; Dykes pulled up lame or else could have scored.
Throw to 2B was in time but hit Hale's outflung foot
Dykes, though lame, staggered across 1B just ahead of throw
Onto the roof of the LF grandstand

Off Poole's shins; Bishop's backup throw nearly got Myatt
Into upper tier of LF bleachers
Bennett dropped the fly but no error charged
$Two steals of home in the same inning

$Bishop slid into 3B tied with Williams' throw which hit him and bounced toward the stands.  Max got up and headed home, though his right leg sagged under him.  After colliding with Rego, Bishop was carried off the field; sprained ankle.

ej,bushj102,P,dinnb101,Call at 3B ej,austj101,C,dinnb101,Call at 3B The Browns protested the decision at 3B; Bush, Austin, and Rego threatened Dinneen but were quieted by Sisler. Bush & Austin ejected by Ump Dinneen.

ej,macke101,C,rowlp801,Call at 1B $LaMotte dove for it, rolled over, and threw to 1B while on the ground.  It hopped past Sisler and rolled into the SLA dugout.  The A's protested that Galloway was entitled to score; play was halted 5-7 minutes for the argument; Athletics coach Earle Mack ejected by HP umpire Pants Rowland
Lamar's fine throw nearly nailed McManus at 2B
Caromed off Bush's left leg.  Play was halted for several minutes while teammates worked on the injury.
High into the upper tier of LF grandstand
Squibbed not 10 feet from the plate; Picinich overran the twisty ball
Great stop, hard throw; close play
Hit railing of upper LF tier
Great stop held it to a single
Post: fumble; Globe: throwing error; Ledger: Todt had to dive for the wide throw
Sensational stab of liner headed to CF.  Lucey tried to double-up Welch.
The Sox fielders swung around toward RF for Bagwell, a notorious pull-hitter, just like teams do for Cy Williams. He slapped a long liner to LF that rolled to the wall.

Red Smith (SS) and Fred Heimach (P) were injured by batted balls while pitching batting practice for PHA.  Smith was hit by Heimach, and Heimach was hit on the right knee by someone named Bannister. Heimach limped the rest of the day.
Landed atop a roof on 20th Street; 2nd house from the alley. It was hit so hard RFer Welch never moved.
High hopper; Lucey's futile throw to 1B was wide and skipped into the RF vacuum.  Infield playing DP depth.

Rain began falling, coming down harder as Lucey fanned. Rommel was getting ready to pitch to Heving when Ump Owens called time and headed for shelter.  Rain stopped after 10 minutes or so, but play was delayed 35-40 minutes due to the wet grounds.  As play resumed, the field was soft, but not too muddy. Players had a hasty limbering-up drill and the game was resumed at 4:55pm.
Just missed HR, high off the screen; held to single mainly due to heavy/slithery track on the baselines.
Lucey knocked it down and had no play but hurled a low throw to 2B anyway and it skipped into RF.
PHA: Bishop out 3 weeks with broken ankle bone; Dykes out with a strained tendon.
On attempted double steal Ruel's throw to 3B hit Simmons on the shoulder and bounded into LF, but Ump Nallin ruled Simmons out for interference.
Delayed steal attempt while Grove was wiping off the ball.
Against the roof of LF bleachers
Over RF fence hitting against the bay windows of 20th Street homes.  Hit HR after fouling two SH attempts.
Grove muffed a return throw from Berry
Catchable but Welch/Dykes let it drop

2 knucklers followed by an outside fastball
Rommell ran at Ruffing and tagged him out near 2B

Lee knocked it down and had to go a couple steps to pick it up; Simmons rounded 3B and kept on coming.  Good throw home; close play.  Simmons swerved toward diamond and made a hook slide to avoid the tag.
Marvelous throw; Bishop had to avoid the charging Galloway
Drag bunt past Ehmke; Galloway slid into 1B
Bischoff threatened a pickoff on the first pitch, then threw to 1B on the 2nd pitch as Galloway raced to 2B.

Over RF wall and into 20th Street
More like a drag bunt; Quinn seemed to have a play at 2B for a potential DP but tossed to 1B.
Dropped it after a long run
Bishop darted for 2B while Wingfield stood on the rubber. Simmons raced home as Wingfield threw to 2B, and scored before Wamby could run Bishop down.
A funnel cloud threatened to blow Quinn off the mound in the 8th but he held his ground after a scare.
A leaping Galloway got a glove on it
Wingo's throw got through Jones and rolled to Woodall who fired to 1B trying to catch Harriss. Galloway tried to sneak home on that throw.
Texas Leaguer fell between Wingo and Rigney; Rigney bumped it towards the LF stands but no error.
Heilmann lost it in the sun
Just out of Cobb's reach. The throw-in was lost in short CF; by the time O'Rourke found it and fired it home, Hale had scored standing up.
Long sprinting catch that looking impossible even when it's going on.
Prodigious HR against the bridge work in front of the LF upper deck.

Lamar charged in and threw to 3B; the hit had taken Hale out of position so he was backing up 3B assuming Galloway would cover the bag.  But Galloway was looking for a throw to 2B. The throw hit Sheely and bounced toward the grandstand, so he started for home until he saw Walberg pounce on it, and struggled back to 3B.  Galloway made a brilliant catch of Walberg's throw and a fine tag. Sheely argued the call with Ump Connolly.

Marvelous 1-handed catch, spearing it a foot off the ground. Simmons threw home sidearm on the run; it was slightly off- line so that when Cochrane caught it he couldn't quite reach Schalk who slid wide and inside the line away from the tag.
Great ovation for Lyons as he left the mound
Hale fanned on a curve; both runners were on the move.

Reached out for a wide one and drove it into RF

However, the pitch was ruled ball four and more arguing ensued.
